summary: Helgander is a cozy ancient Nordic dwelling turned player home perfect for the over-organized among us, featuring over 100 displayable items added by General Displays by Tueffel and various new assets added by various modder's resources.
descriptionHtml:
[center][b][size=6]﻿[/size][/b][/center][center][font=Times New Roman][size=6]HELGANDER

[/size][/font][font=Verdana][size=4]﻿[/size][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=4]After four years of creating unreleased mods for Skyrim, I am proud to finally say that I feel confident enough to release Helgander, a refurbished Nordic ruin to act as a home fit for a true adventurer!

Ever felt as if there are too many grandiose player homes on the Nexus? Are you looking for something that is cozy yet not too frugal? Looking for something unique? These were the inspirations to Helgander, an ancient Nordic dwelling located in the southmost portion of the volcanic tundra of Hjaalmarch. [/size][/font]

[font=Georgia][color=#b6b6b6][size=2]For the adventurer in all of us.[/size][/color][/font][/center][font=Times New Roman][size=6]FEATURES:
[/size][/font]• 107 total displayable items and objects (Maximum of 96 without clipping issues)
• Various new assets added by various modder's resources (Sources and Credits at bottom)
• Display items, weapons, and armors acquired through your questing adventures through General Displays
• Seven bookshelves to display 73 books in total
• Three armor mannequins
• Four single-weapon weapon plaques
• One large weapon plaque (Two weapons and one shield)
• Two weapon racks
• 25 specific/custom containers
[code]﻿[spoiler]
﻿• Ore Bucket
﻿• Ingot Pile
﻿• Pelt Basket
﻿• Bone Basket
﻿• Miscellaneous Remains Bucket
﻿• Smithing Supplies
﻿• Weapon Barrel
﻿• Armor Chest
﻿• Shield Chest
﻿• Baking Ingredients

﻿• Cutlery

﻿• Gem Box
﻿• Potion Basket

﻿• Dwemer Scrap Pile
﻿• Ingredients Basket
﻿• Scrolls basket
﻿• Soul Gem Basket
﻿• Stave Chest
[/spoiler][/code]
• 26 generic/vanilla containers (for your organizational needs)
[code]﻿[spoiler]

﻿﻿• 4 Small sacks

﻿﻿• 2 Desks
﻿﻿• 1 Satchel
[/spoiler][/code]
• General Displays Treasure Container to display the following items:

﻿• Masque of Clavicus Vile /} (Both Replacable with Riften Guard Shield)

﻿• Ring of Namira
﻿• Ring of Hircine
﻿• The Skeleton Key
﻿• Savior's Hide

﻿• Dawnbreaker (Replacable with Keening)
﻿• Ebony Blade (Replacable with Harkon's Sword)
• Aetherial Crown

• Aetherial Shield

[/code]• Custom Enchanting and Alchemy Workstations
• Wash Basin and Mirror (So your character can finally achieve acceptable hygiene)
• Blankets (So your character can finally not freeze to death in the middle of the cold Skyrim nights(Not entirely functional, just aesthetic))
• All Basic Crafting Stations
﻿• Alchemy Station
﻿• Enchanting Station
﻿• Anvil
﻿• Smelting Pot
﻿• Tanning Rack
﻿• Workbench
﻿• Grindstone
﻿• Cooking Pot
﻿• Baking Oven

[font=Times New Roman][size=6]KNOWN BUGS/ERRORS:
[/size][/font]- Flickering lights/lights that seem to turn on and off as you look in certain directions: Unfortunately due to the engine limitations of Skyrim, this cannot be fixed without significantly impacting the quality of the lighting. These issues appear to be only minor and do not significantly impact the mod.
- When exiting Helgander, some users may be teleported inside of the stairs leading to the house. The reason for this occurrence is unknown, though is but a minor bug that is not much more than an annoyance/slight immersion-breaker.
- Some users may see the "Treasure Container" as a safe rather than a chest.
- When approaching close to the Treasure Container, the game's framerate dips. It is unknown what causes this, and seems to either be just a bug on my end or a bug with the model.

[font=Times New Roman][size=6]PERMISSIONS:
[/size][/font]-Do not reupload this mod to any site without my permission.
-You are free to make addons and translations for this mod, as long as you do not reupload the entire mod (This mod must be required to be installed along with your addon/translation), a link to this mod is provided, and you provide credit. Just remember that some of the assets and work is not mine and due credit should be given to the proper authors. Other permissions may apply to their work.

[center][color=#ffff00]You may contact me about any questions, concerns, or comments at TheCryoHazard@gmail.com or through the Nexus[/color][/center]
[font=Times New Roman][size=6]RESOURCES AND CREDITS:
[/size]
[size=3][center]All necessary credit goes to the fantastic modder's resource developers listed below,
who made this mod possible. I only take credit for creating the house itself.[/center][/size]

[/font][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17423/]Artisanix's "Paintings and Frames Resource"[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/16525/]Oaristys' "Modder's Resource Pack"[/url]﻿

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/62733/?]Lolicept's "Lolicept Resources"[/url]﻿

[size=1]The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim is developed by Bethesda Softworks and published by Bethesda Game Studios, and thus since this mod uses assets from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, all rights go to them.[/size]
author: Colonel_Xarxes
